intro: Boehmeria tibetica, commonly known as Tibetan nettle, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other nettle species. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a serrated edge. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Boehmeria tibetica is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
